865058932:
[

Pre Claims Legal Assistant

Company Name Maurice Blackburn Lawyers Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 38 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Summary

Highly rewarding role assisting our clients. Support our friendly Pre Claims team. Develop your knowledge and skills in our Superannuation and Insurance practice.

Overview

The Firm

Since the day Maurice Blackburn opened our doors nearly a hundred years ago, we’ve been in the business of helping people; fighting to make a genuine difference to people’s lives. We exist to help everyday Australians use the law to fight back against unfair treatment. Our passion for righting wrongs is at the heart of everything we do. This is why we’ve grown to become Australia’s leading social justice law firm. After all, we believe wholeheartedly in what we do.

The Team

At Maurice Blackburn we have the largest Superannuation and Insurance claims team in Australia.

Our specialists across the states help individuals with injury or illness to make claims on their Super funds' insurance policies. This provides individuals and their families with a level of security when they are no longer able to work.

Experience tells a story but the right attitude speaks volumes. If you want to make a difference to the lives of everyday Australians and have a mature, empathetic approach to clients and the service we provide then this is the role for you.

The Role

Our Superannuation and Insurance team are currently seeking a Pre Claims Legal Assistant in our Melbourne CBD office on a six month fixed term contract basis. Our Pre Claims team are at the core of what we do and are the initial point of contact for all clients.

The main responsibilities of the team are to manage all initial phone queries from clients and assess the viability of their claims. You will work with clients to investigate their potential claim and prepare them for the claims process.

This role will involve a significant amount of time on the phone with our clients and their funds so good communication skills are vital. You will also be responsible for your own file load and catchment area so this role would suit someone with strong organisational skills.

Ultimately this role would suit someone with a passion for helping our clients and supporting them to achieve the best possible outcome in relation to their claim.

Key Selection Criteria
  • Exceptional customer service skills and experience in working with a diverse range of people;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills;
  • Strong attention to detail;
  • Ability to handle high volume administrative tasks and multiple priorities;
  • Ability to work under pressure in a fast paced environment;
  • Excellent organisational and time management skills;
  • Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite; and
  • Experience in the legal, insurance or medical profession is desirable.


A Law Firm Like No Other.

Work with people who are truly passionate about the work we do and the impact we have on the community. From the kind of people who work here, to the kind of cases we take on, these values have run deeply throughout our organisation for almost a century.

We also offer great employee benefits, some of which include:
  • Ongoing coaching and career development
  • Fully paid gym membership
  • Salary Continuance & Life Insurance
  • 17.5% Annual Leave Loading
  • Wellbeing Programs for you and your family
  • Generous leave entitlements
  • Health and Wellbeing Leave


How To Apply

Click the ‘Apply’ button and include your resume and cover letter.

Seniority Level

Entry level

  • Staffing and Recruiting
  • Law Practice
  • Legal Services

865804281:
[

Senior Data Scientist

Company Name Envato Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 82 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, we're a completely online company with an ecosystem of sites and services to help people get creative. In September 2014, one of our sites, ThemeForest, was the 90th most visited website in the world and it remains among the most visited Australian-owned website on the planet! With more than 350 staff and contractors worldwide, we've helped a community of creative sellers earn more than $500 Million.

JobAdvisor awarded us the title of Australia's Coolest Company for Women and Diversity (2015 and 2016). We were also named as one of the Best Places to Work in Australia in the 2015, 2016, 2017 and 2018 BRW Awards.


On Envato Market thousands of people earn a living selling things like WordPress themes, photos, music tracks and illustrations. With Envato Elements, we oversee one of the world’s largest subscription services for digital creatives, providing hundreds of thousands of files for unlimited download for one flat fee. We offer website design and hosting with Envato Sites. On our education platform Tuts+, over 5 million people learn skills including code, illustration, photography, web design, and more, each month. We also run a freelance marketplace called Envato Studio. We've also just acquired Placeit, an awesome logo-building & mockup tool built out of Guadalajara, Mexico!

\xa0

You might be surprised to know that not only do we run some of the biggest websites in the world, we’re also growing really fast!


What you’ll be doing


Envato is split into four major business units which support our customers, authors, internal platforms and new ventures. Our data science team is a centralised function sitting within the Platform division, reporting to the Analytics Director. This new and growing area is taking on greenfield work to drive cutting-edge solutions that will make our products more intelligent\xa0 across everything from customer lifetime value & churn prediction, to personalisation through robust innovations in search & recommendation engines. Data is central to our growth strategy, and as a result, we’re scaling quickly in this area.


As a Senior Data Scientist at Envato, you will work closely with senior stakeholders, the Analytics Director, Product Managers, Data Scientists, Engineers and the Business Intelligence unit to analyse data, highlight opportunities for the team. You will play an instrumental role in understanding and predicting customer behaviour through predictive modelling and segmentation, translating outcomes into clear and actionable insights.\xa0


You’ll be on the hunt to problem solve and identify root causes of positive and negative trends. You will take part in planning and measuring company KPI’s, supporting business goals such as churn prevention and optimising customer search. \xa0Having the ability to manipulate and analyse large, complex data sets and turning them into actionable business insights will be pivotal to this position. You will also be required to educate and supervise model implementation and adoption, driving our online customer and revenue growth. (YAY!)

\xa0

What we’re looking for

  • Strong experience working in digital analytics or data science
  • BA in statistics/math/computer science, or another quantitative field would be an advantage
  • Experience in building and maintaining customer based models such as LTV, churn and customer segmentation
  • Experience with search & recommendation engines is highly desirable
  • Exposure to data mining and machine learning
  • Extensive knowledge of R and SQL (but we're fairly agnostic so if you love Python or another programming language, we'd still like to hear from you)
  • Experience with building models from scratch and implementing them across company
  • Ability to translate problems into definable actions
  • Experience with big data would be an advantage
  • Ability to build effective relationships with individuals across all levels of an organisation
  • Strong demonstrated alignment to Envato’s values

\xa0

What we offer

  • A fantastic culture of creatively minded, hard working people who are passionate about Envato and being part of its growth and success
  • Flexible working conditions – we want you to love your work but also your life outside of Envato
  • We actively work on creating a safe, inclusive environment free from discrimination
  • A fast paced and progressive environment where everyone has regular interaction with teammates and Envato community members from all over the world!
  • Read more from our staff about why they love working at Envato by visiting www.jobadvisor.com.au/envato
  • We’re offering a competitive salary package & benefits ($110k-$150k package, but flexible depending on experience)


Who should apply?

We care deeply about diversity and inclusion at Envato, and welcome applicants of all types, and from all backgrounds. If you think you have the skills and experience needed for this role then we'd like to hear from you.

\xa0

What next?

Submit a cover letter, an up to date copy of your resume and answers to the below questions. Good luck!

865518523:
[

Senior Finance Analyst

Company Name Vanguard Australia Company Location Riverside Quay, Southbank Victoria 3006

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 193 views

Job description

Vanguard Australia has been helping investors achieve their long-term financial goals for almost 20 years. Serving institutional and individual clients, and financial advisers, we offer investment solutions that are low-cost, diversified and robust through time.

\xa0

We are currently looking for a Senior Finance Analyst to join our FP&A (Financial Planning & Analysis) team to provide financial analysis and advice to an assigned client group within Vanguard.

\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0

About the role:

As a Senior Finance Analyst in FP&A, you will partner with the business to deliver better outcomes for our investors through effective Profit & Loss and Balance Sheet management. Key focus areas include strategy development, business planning and reporting while delivering ongoing actionable insights.

\xa0

You will also be responsible for:

  • Preparing financial analyses and models to assist in the evaluation of business initiatives, such as robust cost estimates/forecasts and clarity on stated business case benefits;
  • Using financial analyses to provide insightful and relevant commentary for senior levels of management and undertaking sensitivity analysis to validate / challenge business assumptions;
  • Building and managing both domestic and global relationships with key stakeholders, providing analytical and commercial advice to Management and the Executive Team;
  • Assisting in the identification of the KPIs and success criteria that will be used to track business case progress;
  • Conducing ad hoc and periodic evaluations and reviews to help assess the profitability of product lines and distribution channels;
  • Participating as a key member of project teams, providing financial modelling support in line with the business’ needs;
  • Preparing timely and accurate financial information to allow for efficient use and control over financial resources of a business unit and projects.


About you:

You will enjoy problem solving, be comfortable with ambiguity, possess a high level of customer focus and think like a founder.


You will also have:

  • Minimum of five to eight years of related work experience (ideally within the Financial Services industry);
  • Strong communication and stakeholder management skills;
  • Ability to interface with people at all levels in the organization;
  • Strong analytical and organizational skills;
  • Ability to quickly gain knowledge of unfamiliar business operations and technology and assertiveness to seek out information through contacts throughout the organization;
  • Experience with Microsoft Office preferred, other analysis or database software acceptable.


About our Culture:

The Vanguard culture is grounded in our core values of integrity, focus, and stewardship. It is that unique culture that drives the organization to be the best place to work and invest for Crew (our employees) and clients. Vanguard cultivates an environment of Inclusion where each individual is valued and recognized for who they are as well as their unique contributions, resulting in a highly engaged crew.

\xa0

Vanguard values the diverse strengths, backgrounds, experiences and identities that crew bring to the organization. With a representative crew, we realize the full potential that unique perspectives have on making decisions in our clients’ best interests.

\xa0

If this sounds like the right opportunity and culture for you, apply online now!

Associate Service Delivery Manager - Permanent Opportunity!

Organisation
We love technology and we get a big kick out of helping companies use technology wisely to create a competitive edge and be ready for the unexpected, whatever that may be. We understand the challenges that today's businesses face and we enjoy finding innovative and cost-effective technology solutions.

We believe that the true benefit of information technology is utilising it to unlock innovation that enables greater operational efficiency and better business effectiveness. Ultimately, this is why we get out of bed every morning.

The opportunity
we have a an exciting opportunity for a Associate Service Delivery Manager to join our team.

We are seeking interest from like-minded professionals who believe they can add value to our organisation by being truly passionate about owning the on-going service relationship with the assigned key managed services customer accounts.

Join our successful Service Integration & Management team, as part of the Service Delivery function to provide expertise in the management of service level agreements and on-going service management, including reporting, across our varied customer base in both government and commercial sectors.

What's in it for you?

  • Permanent career opportunity
  • Exceptional working environment and culture
  • Genuine autonomy and ownership
  • Supportive and collaborative service delivery team
  • Flexible working arrangements
Role requirements

  • Solid experience with problem, incident and change management in an ITIL environment

APPLY Button.

All positions at AC3 are subject to a police clearance.
